benchmark_details.name: TECHHAZARD QA
benchmark_details.overview: TECHHAZARD QA is a benchmark dataset containing complex queries designed to elicit responses in both text and instruction-centric formats to evaluate the potential for generating harmful or unethical content by LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess how LLMs respond to instruction-centric prompts and to evaluate the risks associated with generating unethical content.

data.source: Curated dataset of complex queries crafted to expose vulnerabilities in large language models.
data.annotation: Manually curated and moderated for harmful content

methodology.calculation: Evaluation against responses categorized as harmful or non-harmful based on GPT-4 and human assessments.
methodology.interpretation: A higher harmfulness score indicates a greater likelihood of unethical output generation.
methodology.validation: Tested on multiple LLMs including Llama-2 and Mistral models across various settings.

harm: Increased risk of generating harmful or unethical outputs via instruction-centric prompts.
